values: Forever Knight!! That's the TV show I've been trying to think of!  Anybody else watch this?  It was on the Sci-Fi channel years ago, about the vampire who was a cop, trying to do finally do some good in his life.  I used to watch it all the time, along with Farscape, Highlander, MacGuyver, etc and another one I can't remember the name of....it had a female lead character who was special somehow (and no, not Alex Mack, even though I used to watch that all the time, too).  There was this place she was being experimented on (The Agency? something like that) that she was always running away from....damn it.  It was a really good show, too.  If anyone has any idea what the hell I'm talking about, let me know....haha.  Hahaha and Lexx used to be on Friday nights, too.  That show was completely and utterly bizarre, but I don't remember enough about it to remember why exactly.  Ahh, good television....haha.  Like 24.  Damn that was a good episode.  Sucks that I won't be able to watch the rest of the season, unless Doug feels ambitious and compresses, burns, and mails me dvd's full of the rest of the season.  Which would be awesome.  And I'd be eternally grateful.  Nudge nudge, wink wink.  Doug, by the way, are you even paying attention?  Aww, fuck it.  Oh, and Puddle Cruiser, the first movie that Broken Lizard made, is terrible.  Effing terrible.  Oh sure, it's funny in parts, mostly because Broken Lizard knows a good joke when they see one, but they have gotten INFINITELY better at delivering lines.  So yeah.  Time to get back to work, I guess.

Have you ever wanted to live the life you see on TV?  I mean, what guy hasn't wanted to be Van Wilder?  Or Jack Bauer for that matter?  And what girl hasn't wanted to be....oh, I don't know, Carrie Bradshaw or Holly Golightly? (I'm just guessing here, I really have no idea who women would want to be - I'd like to know, though, so if any females read this, leave a comment of who you'd want to be).  But anyways, you realize that life isn't like the movies, that life isn't this perfectly planned bit of comedy, or action or drama (well, sometimes there's drama or action, but it's never the it'll all work out in the end, everyone goes home happy except for the bad guy who somehow happens to get what's coming to him kind.  Life is real, and maybe it's because we fantasize about what life could be that it isn't perfect.  Anyway, enough late night rambling, it's time for bed.

What another awesome weekend at Clarkson, full of drinking, drifting, and slamming heads into the ceiling.  Haha and we have videos of all three of them, especially of the drifting (which was awesome) and Jimbo hitting the ceiling (which was fucking hilarious).  Went up Friday and me, the retard, missed the exit to get off of 81 and onto 342/11 and wound up in Alexandria Bay.  So I stop at a pizza place to see if there's a shorter way to get back to Potsdam, and the guys just laugh at me.  Fucking A.  So anyway, I finally get there, play kings and pong for awhile, and then pass out.  Awesomely fun, as always, but the real fun was Saturday night, when Jimbo and Rob pretty much downed an entire bottle of SoCo on their own - I don't think Jim's liver will ever forgive him.  I didn't know it was humanly possible to expunge that much material from one's stomach, but holy hell it didn't stop - he was also still extremely drunk in between passing out and throwing up, so when I was watching Top Gun later on, Jimbo would randomly wake up and start mumbling the lines and then pass out again.  Rob, meanwhile, is doing his damnedest to not throw up, and succeeds (while going on an absolutely fucking hilarious rant while in the bathroom of what exactly is happening inside his body.....you had to be there, and you probably had to have been intoxicated.  The weekend, in a word - hawsum.  



Oh, and for those of you that don't know, I won't be at UB this semester, I'll be studying abroad in France (Toulouse, it's in southwestern France, near Spain, a long way away from Paris).  And the best part is that I get to take engineering classes!  Alright, that's not the best part, in fact it kinda sucks, but whatever.  And no, I still don't know much French.  Oh, and the Olympics are in Torino! which is like 11? hours away by train, which kicks ass.  The prices to see actual events are ridiculous, but even just going there should be a blast - from what I hear, it's one hell of a party the whole time.  And who knows, maybe I'd even get to party with Bode!  We all know he likes his parties, and there are plenty of races to get wasted before.  Ohhh, Bode - you are my hero, and have been since you started kicking so much Austrian ass.  Speaking of skiing, I absolutely plan on skiing in the Alps (or the Pyrenees, whatever, I'm not picky....haha), even more so because this winter has sucked so badly (no snow on the ground, it's 50's and raining?  What the hell is this?).  Come to think of it, we haven't had a decent winter since I left High School....we haven't shown our downstate friends a good snowstorm yet.  I mean, come on! It's not like I'm asking for a blizzard, just enough snow to build a ramp off the back of the garage.  You know, the good old days.  When we used to do stupid shit on a regular basis that usually ended up in us getting hurt somehow.  



But back to France - as much as I'm excited to go (and believe me, I can't wait), I'm also nervous.  And slightly regretful - I don't want to get all sappy and shit, but I'm lucky enough to have some great friends that I'd rather not part with, even if only for a few months.  And if this semester would have been anything like last semester, it would have been amazingly fun.  There's always next year, i guess (but not for too long - holy shit college is going by way too fast!).  But, it's a chance I'm probably not going to get again any time soon, so I'm not going to miss out on it.  Aaaand, I still don't know French.  But I'll survive - I'm likable, aren't I?  Maybe?  Anyway, it should be a blast.  



"So....your adventures are over."
"Oh, no. To live... to live would be an awfully big adventure."
-Hook

This week has without a doubt been the worst of my academic career.  I have never put so much time and effort into studying for exams to be left feeling completely helpless when I actually take them.  And the thing that really pisses me off is that I had an A going into most of these finals, and now I'm just hoping to pass. 



On a better note, Materials was not impossible.  It was damn hard, but not impossible, and that's fine by me.  One more to go, and then the semester will be over......


Alright, enough self-pity, time to go study some more while I pull the second all-nighter in four days.  Oh, just as a sidenote, I found this funny: the bottle of liquid caffeine that I picked up at Wegman's (Monster Energy or some shit like that) came with the following warning:

Consume resposibly - Limit 3 cans per day.  Not recommended for children, pregnant women, or people sensitive to caffeine.
be sorted @ nimbo.net

Grades as they stand now (best guess approximations, of course):
311 - A
334 - C
376 - A
381 - A
335 - B
World Civ -  A-

Which would lead to me getting 3.445, raising me to a 3.233 overall.  Not bad!  If I can raise Scott's class above a C (which is gonna be tough, but possible) to a B-, it's a 3.557, and a B would put me at 3.612 and 3.263 overall, which would mean I'd be on Dean's List for the first time ever!  Of course, with finals still to go in all of those, all A range is....possible? Not sure, but i hope so.  Anyway, this semester is going a lot better than i thought it was, which is good.  Definitely good.

Wow, I haven't updated in a long time. Anyway, this past weekend was one hell of an awesome time - went to Clarkson with Brianna, Laura and Mike to visit Rob and his friends. Some of the pictures, if anyone cares to see them (and you should, because they are awesome), are in Rob's photbucket.  What an awesome weekend - getting Mike absolutely smashed, both nights (getting an early start on college, while not puking either night!), girls making out on the car ride up and then for the trucker on the way back (i think his day was made after seeing that), and while playing spin the bottle for the first time ever, rock climbing on some very loose rocks (and then taking pictures next to the awesome waterfall and saving Rob's life along with Mike....twice....as he ran from the camera he had put on a timer back to the group), pregaming for the hockey game we decided not to go to which included playing Kings and pong way too early in the night (we started drinking at like 5) and then getting up to 100 on the thruway in Brianna's car on the way back while she was asleep.  Ahh, why can't there be more days in the weekend?  That would be splendid.

So now I'm back at UB, and guess who just rocked a 93 on an engineering exam? ME!  That hasn't happened since.....fucking high school.  Hopefully I'll get an A in that class, so i can balance out the C i'll get in Fluids and in Scott's class.....

Thanks to Brianna for the ride, and everyone else for an amazing time, we need to do it again sometime soon...

I don't have much to add except that Pink Floyd is one of the most musically gifted bands of all time.  Oh, and if anyone would like to go see some jazz this weekend, let me know, because I want to go.  That is all.

I should be reading The Iliad now, since I do have a solid forty pages still to read for tomorrow, but I figure it's time for a break.  Maybe I'll even do some drumming - that'd be cool, and my hands don't hurt anymore, since the callous is back!  

Anyone ever get the feeling that you could do something great, something that people would read about in history books, if only you could figure out what that was?  I mean, I'm not one to believe in fate, so I'm wondering if the people we read about decided they were going to do something great (and by great I don't necessarily mean good), or did they just do it?  Sometimes I think I could do something great....it's just getting there that's the problem.  

Also, to my professors - stop sucking ass and actually listen to your students.  If the students in your previous classes told you they wanted more examples, THEN GIVE US MORE EXAMPLES!!  Don't stand there and say that if we ask for more examples, you'll give them to us - you were already told, apparently by a great many people.  And for some reason I can't really wrap my brain around just now, you insist on using the same shitty ass book year in and year out, even though the majority of the students TOLD you the book sucked ass.  And while I know this is impossible, at least in the Engineering department, once, just once, I'd like to learn something relevant to the homework/exams (heaven forbid we actually learn something useful!) in class.  I thought professors were supposed to get better as the courses got harder?

Well, back to the adventures of Achilleus and the gods.  You know, if I weren't genuinely interested in the material, this class would be boring as hell.

I realize this is all my fault, but I am so far behind in work that it is ridiculous....I'll be lucky to be done by four am.  I have two assignments for 311 that are due at 3 tomorrow (one of which involves writing a program in Excel...yippee), which I am somewhat clueless on, having not learned much in mech of materials, a math assignment which I didn't realize was going to be absolutely brutal, I have to start reading The Iliad, because I know I won't get around to next week, my head hurts (I think maybe a migraine coming on?), and all I really want is a hug.  And a nap.  But I'd settle for a hug.....Alright, time to stop bitching and get to work.

Hurray for Discovery landing safely!  It's great to see the shuttles flying again, but I can't help but think that all the money they'll be pouring into redesigning the external tank *again* would be better put to use creating a newer spacecraft?  Or even setting aside a measly $10 million of the budget to start a new X-Prize competition, with the caveat that the winning craft be able to transport cargo into space.  I do think, though, that space travel, venturing out into the unknown, is of the utmost importance.  Of course there will always be those people that is a waste of time and resources, and that the money would be better spent on the poor countries in Africa, etc.  But to this, I say that not only has space exploration given rise to numerous technological and biological advances (with many more to come, I'm sure, once the Space Station is expanded) which will cure many of the ailments we face today, but have we not learned the lesson that throwing money at a problem *never* solves it?  That unless you get to the crux of the problem, figure out how it got there and how to fix it, the problem will only continue to get worse?  Oh, and let us not forget that war, famine, poverty, and general ill will have been around for a looong time, and I just don't see them going away anytime soon, no matter how hard we try (except maybe famine....extremely difficult, but possible - the others will always plague us).  

Oh, one other thing - I think that it will be private corporations, and not NASA, ESA, China or Russia that will take us to the stars, and I intend to be there.  One way or the other.  Hell, if I have my way, it'll be my corporation leading the way for millions to travel into space.

So I've been thinking a lot about life lately, mostly in general terms, but about mine as well.  I'm glad I took the internship at Hadley this summer, since it gave me some valuable insight into the career I wish to follow.....and that career doesn't involve doing CAD every damn day. It pays very well, but it is so boring.  3D modeling, on the other hand, is fun, and i enjoy it.  Designing seems to be where's it at, though, at least for now.  I just want something that pays relatively well, where there isn't a ton of personal interaction, and that I can enjoy doing.  That's not asking too much, is it?

I still have to find out more about this semester in France, but I definitely want to go - it looks like it'll be soo much fun.  And the Olypmics are in Torino!! I can see Bode tear shit up on the biggest mountains I've ever seen - fucking awesome, I know. And then I can travel all around Europe during the weekends and breaks, spending all of the money I've earned this summer.  Eh, it'll totally be worth it.  And I can't wait for school to start, but not until we take a road trip somewhere....

Someone actually had "The Searchers" on DC++?? Goddamn!!  Oh, by the way, if you want to see the worst movie ever made, find "Frank McClusky, C.I.".  You'll have to search for it, it'll be there.  


Oh, and if anyone has any of the following songs, that would be kickass:
"Tweedlee Dee" by LaVern Baker, "That's All Right" by Arthur "Big Boy" Crudup, "Blue Moon of Kentucky" by Bill Munroe, "Good Rockin' Tonight" by Wynonie "Blues" Harris, "Flying Purple People Eater" by Sheb Wooley, "Nice Work If You Can Get It" by The Hi-Los, "Diamond Head" by The Ventures, and "Needles and Pins" by The Searchers.

So I was watching "Crossing Jordan" tonight, and it was about a guy who was going around killing people. The problem was that he was killing child molesters.  Apparently his child was one of the children who was abducted, and he became a vigilante father out for blood. Noble concept, but it got me thinking, if I were the cop in the show, what is the right thing to do? I mean, he is cleaning the streets of possibly the worst people on the planet.  But he is also committing a crime himself.  I guess if you believe in justice, you have to catch the killer, but for me, there would be a moral issue.  Same with "The Boondock Saints" (awesome movie, by the way; see it if you haven't already), people killing other killers and assorted bad men.  But who's to say they are right?  I don't know, I think you have to draw the line somewhere, though.  I believe there are different types of justice, and your view depends upon which version of justice you place highest on the list...justice of the law, moral justice, poetic justice...now I'm just rambling...haha

So now I'm sitting here, watching a movie, and missing the one I love the most...on the bright side, there's only a week left until school starts again!! I am definitely ready to kick some ass this semester.  I also need to find a job....shit.  One that gives me a lot of money.  Anboddy have any suggestions for internships for the summer?  I think it'd be awesome to intern at the Jet Propulsion Lab in California, even if it'd be bitch work.  Hell, I'd do any work there.  Or any NASA place for that matter.  What if they saw me and wanted me to be an astronaut?? Now THAT would be fucking awesome.  Even though it would never happen, because of my goddamn vision.  But if it did? Holy shit.  Or if they just hired me and decided to pay me a lot of money, and I could just not finish school.  Or a test pilot!!!  Booyah.  I would totally do that. In a heartbeat.  My fingers are crossed.  Whatever I end up doing, I hope I'm having fun.

Memories are wonderful things, if you don't have to deal with the past.....

Let me be your freedom,
Let daylight dry your tears.
I'm here with you, 
Beside you,
To guard you and to guide you . . .

Just got back from seeing "The Phantom Of The Opera," and all I can say is WOW.  Amazing movie, amazing jobs by all those involved, especially Gerry Butler (The Phantom)... The singing was absolutely fantastic, the music (especially through Regal's surround sound, the bass on "The Overture" was just tremendous)....wow.  I must admit, I was a bit scared going in, what with the Batman killer directing, but Joel did not let down on this one

So anyway, I have decided that not being in shape sucks, and I've started working out.  Seems to be working, and fast (and I'm not even that sore, either!)  Hopefully I'll have the willpower to keep this up, because it feels nice to be in shape.

By the way, it says "Balls" on your face.

Miss you more with every passing moment...

So I at least have one guarenteed A, which is always nice to have.  Rocked a 97 on the Statics final...boo-fucking-yah!  In other news, Halo has officially started up again, which is awesome.  Annnnd, my parents got that Blockbuster pass where you can rent as many movies as you want in a month for 15 bucks, and we have already made it worthwhile...three times over?  I think so.  Currently watching "Blade II", meh, seems alright at least.  Wesley Snipes is one badass motherfucker.

Goddamn I miss Mary, and it's only been a couple of days....I can't wait until New Years!

I guess I have mixed feelings as to the things I've accomplished this semester....perhaps they will become unmixed after exams are over with (I hope so, for it means I'll have done well!).  I did get a 94 on my Diff Eq final, which was awesome, and I think I did really well on Statics (barring retarded errors, of course).  Thermo is a tossup (I think I have a pretty solid B right now), and will be figured out later today, when I face the final.  Ahhhhhhh.  Physics? Still a complete mystery to me just where the fuck they get the exam questions from.  Goddamn it.  Markelz? Can you pleeease, for once, just give us a straight-forward question.  Doesn't have to be easy, I don't care about that.  Just me able to understand just what the fuck I'm supposed to do.  Grr. Well, there's always the final.  And then MAE, that bullshit class that I didn't put enough effort in to get an A.  Ungraded group project and final to go, though, so who knows.  I think my study habits are much much better than last year, though.  More time in Lockwood is in store for next year.  

Looking for good music? Check out Interpol and Lacuna Coil. Alright, I'm out.

Oh man, Colin Powell is leaving his Cabinet post? Damn it, and he was one of the only members on the Cabinet that I liked, let alone respected.  I mean, Donny Rumsfeld is cool and all, but.....haha.  Don't really know how I feel about Condi taking his place, either.  Buut, maybe Colin is stepping down to prepare to run for President!! Ahhh, I wish.  I suspect so do a lot of people.  Maybe Rudy Guiliani should take Powell's spot, that would be awesome.  Now that I think about it, it might actually work!
I love Mary Elizabeth Walsh!  So so much.  That's all for now.  More coming tomorrow, I promise.

Phew, thank god those two weeks are over...good lord.  One extreme bright spot, though- I got a 95 on a Statics exam!!, which fucking rocked.  Now if only I did nearly as well on a couple other exams...*cough* Physics *cough*.  I learned a few very valuable lessons, though (chiefly that Physics TA's are douchebags).  And I think if the hostility I felt towards Errington were directly proportional to the grade I got (and I pray to God it is...haha), I wouldn't be so worried about the grade on the first test... 

So, yeah.  The past couple weeks have been extremely stressful, almost to the breaking point, but I made it through the first wave battered but no worse for the wear.  Alright.  Deep breaths now.  Haha just don't look that far forward, or you'll see the next batch coming.  And no one wants that, now do they?  I might even have time to be online now!  That would be cool.  

I leave you with these words of wisdom....

The power is yours!!
(just admit it, you watched it too)

Wow, I haven't written here in a looong time...

So yeah, things the past few weeks have been stressful.  Very, very stressful.  But, such is life, I suppose, and I consider myself very lucky that I have someone so amazing to help keep me sane...thank you so much.

Haha if anyone cares, I think I'm doing well this semester (some of you would say that's a surprise, but screw you....haha).  Statics doesn't seem as hard as it did before, Diff Eq seems to be going well, the only hard one is Thermo- not only is it a bitch, it just had puppies.  I guess I'll just keep swimming....

Yeah, euchre's done for a long time.  At least for money.  And at least against Steve and Cait.  Shit.  Lost so much money, and it just isn't fun anymore.  We (Mary and I) just can't seem to get anything going, which is odd considering we are both not that bad when it comes to euchre (and when I say "not that bad", I really mean "fucking awesome"...haha)

Other than that, things are going extremely well so far this semester; classes aren't thaaaat bad, even Statics (and even though I fucking hate you, Ahmad), I'm getting my work done, I'm staying afloat, and I spend all my free time with the woman I love.  Kick ass.  Needless to say, I am quite happy these days.

Oh, and Mary, I'll never get tired of it. Come on now...hehe
You mean way too much to me for it ever to get to me.  Here's to many happy memories more.  And happy nights....

And some of you would probably like to know what's been going on with this LJ, but all I'll say is that it's been fun.

So I guess the summer's quest to find out who I really am has reached a conclusion, not because I fully know who I am, but because the summer's over....I am beginning to really figure out what matters to me and what doesn't, who I want to be and who I don't, and what really is important to me.  But I think out of all of this thinking and all of this stressfull worrying, I came to realize one very important fact, and that is that I will never truly find myself, I will never find a set of rules that govern me and that's that.  I doubt I will ever know exactly what to do in a given situation, but hell, that's part of the experience.  And feeling is all that matters, right?  I mean, in the end, only one thing really matters, and it's not hard to find it.  

To anyone I've offended or pissed off or not given my all to in the past, I apologize.  I hope this will not hurt our relationship in the future, for every single one of you make the journey worth it.

i made it up Schintzius, that great disheartening beast of a hill, then Haag (although, the first downhill is awesome, i wish i had the speedo to tell me how fast i was going, because i definitely broke the speed limit there), then Feddick, not too bad, Shero, again nothing that bad (down Shero = me going so fast the bike shakes.  i hope to God I never meet a car coming up that hill, or there will be no hope for me.  even if i have the presence of mind to unclip, there's still that small matter of ditching a projectile hurtling down pavement at speeds around 40 miles an hour. ow.) but, no matter how much i was willing to let my legs burn, i couldn't make it up Liebler.  *bows head in shame*  yeah, i know, i'm weak.  haha.  but, an awesome workout nonetheless, i had ridden probably over 20 miles before I got to Liebler.  not bad, i'll get there yet.  now, time for some food.

Easy bike ride today, only 14 miles without any hills.  Not too bad, especially since I was on the road bike. 

Today was probably the happiest I've been since I wasn't in this county, and I don't really know why.  Probably a couple of things.  I think I realize things better when people don't try and make me realize it, unless I make a selfconscious effort. 

Oh, and I watched a show on the Discovery Channel (which has some of the coolest shows on television) about a Trans-Atlantic tunnel.  Amazingly cool. Engineers estimate that the total trip would take, oh.....less than an hour.  That means that the train would need to go at an average speed of about 4000 miles per hour.  In other words, Mach 6.  Booyah!  I'm thinking the acceleration could literally rip people out of their seats.  Now THAT would be a train ride.  Estimated cost for this endeavor? A measly $11 trillion dollars.  As in, much more than the total US production in a year.  It's said that it would require the steel output from every steel mill in the world, for over a year.  This is part of the whole idea to put a highway all across the world (which would require a bridge in the Bering Strait, and I don't know quite how that will work.....), which isn't a bad idea, it's just awesomely expensive. Ah well, here's the future.  (And as for the future, does anyone that reads this believe in the Singularity?  If so, I'd be interested in hearing if/when you think it will happen and why).

Last Ten Movies I've Seen:
The Graduate
The Matrix
Leon
Amelie 
On The Waterfront
The Manchurian Candidate
Last Of The Mohicans
Ferris Bueller's Day Off
The Boondock Saints
Mallrats

The body varial, the flare tailwhip, the double flare, Buyten dislocating his shoulder twice!!! while doing Step Up and still not stopping....and this is in the first two days!! God I love the X Games.
I had an epiphany yesterday, what alcoholics call, "a moment of clarity."  Haha good movie.  That's all for now.

First of all, congratulations Lance Armstrong, you showed us all the true meaning of domination.  Pure, unadultered domination.  And we (or at least I) enjoyed every second of it.  Thank you.  

Secondly, I had a dream last night that was so real I thought I was still in real life.  When the phone rang, it wasn't so much me waking up as it was my world be jarred away from me.  Which seems to be happening more and more often.  I remember it had something to do with Wombosi (the object of Bourne's failed assasination attempt) from "The Bourne Identity", an old mansion, and a lot of people....  This one was definitely not as cool or exciting as the one I had a few days ago, where I was an Animorph...now that one was just awesome.  The coolest morph had to be a falcon...flying around, up near the clouds...nothing beats that feeling of freedom.  Although, being a tiger felt damn cool too. I wish I could have the dream every night, because it was just amazing.  Too bad it wasn't real.....  






i grasp at a thousand dreams,
and catch but none at all. 
i feel the world close in around me,
and am powerless to stop it all.
but somewhere in dark deep despair, 
you found me hiding there,
and like a ray of light to those in dark,
i can finally see where i'm going.

So work is going well, I'm making money at least.  And I just found out that car insurance for me on my own will be $1300 a year, a hell of a lot less than I thought it was going to be at $2400.  And Doug will help me buy/insure a car, which means that soon, very soon, I will not have to drive the Windstar everywhere.  And that is awesome news, because I can't quite apex a turn correctly without feeling like I'm going to roll the damn thing.  Even better news is that when I do have a car, going to visit a certain someone who I live way too far away from will become so much easier.  

How many more weeks? Too many, that's for damn sure.

22 mile bike ride and I am exhausted, especially after working six hours this morning.  Annnd I wish I was still among the beautiful hills.  But, at least i'm making progress, and that has to count for something, doesn't it?

Wow.  Just wow.  Mary, thank you so much for an absolutely amazing weekend.  After time spent like that, I cannot possibly wait until the last weekend in August....miss you!!   This tops the list of great memories, even though we didn't see a sunrise together....hope to see you soon!!

Halo party against the Iranians....damn were they good.  But then again so were the asians.  And those other kids....basically everyone is better than us...haha.  We're good in our own right, but compared to these guys, we are first time noobies.  Ahh, good times.  Here's to Phoenix Rising.

Finally starting to get in shape!! Yay!  Hopefully I'll get cleared to do more tomorrow, that would be awesome.  I mean, it hurts a little, but not nearly enough to keep me from doing anything, all I need to know is if exercise will damage it any further...if not, awesome.  I tried swimming the other day, with mixed results.  Hurt a little bit, enough to keep me from swimming hard, but it felt so good to swim.  And to catch up with Lindsay, Amy, and the Mays.  Haven't talked to Lindsay in a looong time, and haven't seen Amy since ski season.  Mayyybe we can talk my dad into buying the cottage next door!!  That would be awesome, Silver Lake is a cool place.  Small lake, but big enough to do watersports.  Which is a must for any cottage.  I mean, come on.  Going to a cottage on a lake and not waterskiing (or motoboarding for that matter)?  What kind of heresy is that?  And plus, it would give him an excuse to buy a boat, and I know he wants one.  (Haha but then again, he's talking about buying an M Roadster....which would be AWESOME!! But, I know he probably won't.  I'm not going to talk him out of it, though)  And plus, it's close enough to make a day trip or even a few-hour trip to there, which means I'd probably be up there all the time. 

Haha starting to get better at euchre, or Mary is just so damn good that it makes up for me....anyway I am in the 1900's on Yahoo!, which i was excited about.  I just hope we can keep this rampage going....
It's starting to get to me, as much as I try and fight it. Ah well, such is life I guess.

Just got back from a bike ride with my dad, he kicked my everloving ass on the hills.....but I can still get him on the flats (which I shouldn't feel too good about, I am on the better bike...haha oh well).  He's been doing this for awhile, I just started.   But hey, I feel great after riding, so it really doesn't matter.  I think it would be cool to do a triathlon in the fall, and that's probably a lot of wishful thinking, but it would be a good goal and I would feel like I've actually accomplished something, a feat not known to me very often.  Something to think about (and I'd still like to run a marathon, I'm just not motivated enough to actually train, so if anyone wants to run one with me, feel free to ask, because even if i didn't run it, I'll at least get into decent shape).

Last night was the Eric Clapton concert.  The Man has to be like 60 years old, and he is still the greatest blues guitarist alive.  It's amazing.  And it was an amazing show!! Haha everyone stood up and started shouting when they heard the intro to "Layla"....such an amazing song.  Best solo of the night by far was in "I Shot The Sheriff"....weird, I know, but it was amazing nonetheless.  I swear the crowd was as loud as when Clapton and crew were playing when he left the stage the first time.  They didn't even try to cover up the fact that he was coming back onstage, either.  They left some of the lights on, showing the roadies setting the instruments up.  And come on, no encore?  From the guitar god himself?  Haha he had already played "Layla", so I was happy.  But we got to hear "Crossroads", and that was awesome.  (Oh, and I had "Let It Rain" lyrics in my away message that night, and guess what the first song was?  Booyah. Great song.  And Steve Gadd on drums....never faltered once.  Everyone nailed their parts.  And plus there were drunken people dancing below is, the drunk chick molesting the railing because no one would dance with her, and the redneck....classic.  

Haha and I know this isn't a "cool" entry, Mary, but I don't expect anyone to post anyway, and you're so damn cool that it doesn't matter anyway.  Next weekend.....

So things are finally settling down from an absolutely amazing weekend that was home to some great memories that might help to keep me sane over the rest of the summer....i just hope it happens again soon (only 7 1/2 more weeks, and I cannot wait).  As for Ben Folds, you are amazing, especially live.  Oh, and so is the drummer for Guster...you are also amazing.  The guy that came on before Ani DiFranco on the other hand....not so amazing.  At all.

In other news, I went for a bike ride yesterday! Booyah.  It felt so good to finally get a workout in.  And the collarbone didn't hurt too bad!! Except on Shintzius, which was the hardest hill I've been on so far, it was a damn good thing I was on the Trek.  Also the longest ride I've been on, which was cool, and there weren't too many hills besides the huge one, which I like; I can just crank the gears up as high as it goes, and go as fast as I can, because speed is my drug.

Spiderman 2....best sequel ever, best summer movie ever, and possibly the best superhero movie ever made.  It was that good.  Flashes of brilliance behind the camera by Sam Raimi (some great camera shots...especially when Spidey confronts Doc Ock....), some surprising good acting for an action movie (let alone a comic book movie) from....well....everyone.  As well as awesome action scenes, 2 was loaded with scenes charged with emotion, scenes that actually moved me, something you don't find in most comic book movies (especially Peter dreaming about Uncle Ben....great scene).  I think my favorite scene just might be the subway, right before Doc Ock comes back....just so powerful.  As usual, Stan Lee makes his appearence, albeit for less than a second.  Guest appearence also by The Lizard, which not too many people caught (I sure didn't the first time, it was only after the movie that Mike reminded me who he was in human form).  More than a few references to "Evil Dead", now that I think of it, including the operation scene with Doc Ock, and the cameo by Bruce Campbell.  They are making six Spiderman movies....six!! Booyah!  I hope Venom is the villian for the third movie, now that would make for a kickass movie...although they don't come much better than Doc Ock, especially with Alfred Molina doing an absolutely perfect job portraying him.

Spiderman 2 tonight!!! Booyah- it's been touted as the best superhero movie ever made.....so i'm thinking my eight dollars is definitely more than justified.  Highest ticket presale of any movie ever means that it will be completely swamped tonight at Regal.  I don't mind at all, as long as the movie's good!

Again on the upside, my arm is feeling better, and I love talking with Mary.  I really need to learn how to give a compliment correctly...haha.  And the weekend is coming!!! So excited!  I mean, what's better than good music, good friends and good times?

No way!! A philosophy course titled "The Matrix"!  Could a course be more perfect for me?  Not even if they tried!  And, hopefully i'll be able to take Percussion Ensemble as well.....now that schedule would just be amazing.  If not that, then Jazz Ensemble with Dave Schiavone....booyah.  Both of them plus another class would put me at, oh, say 25 credit hours.  Not too bad, since four of them would be doing something that I would never consider work, ever.   Buuuut, that might be a little bit harsh, considering Statics, Thermo and Diff Eq are also in that semester....but we'll see what happens.

I've finished a whole year of school, and I don't know what I want to do with my life.  Of course I'll probably stick with engineering, because it'll be easy to find a good paying job, but is that what I really want to do?  No.  Probably not.  

After Rob, Mike, Mike and I stopped playing Halo, we discussed Michael Moore's "Fahrenheit 9/11" and how absolutely ludicrous that title is.  But anyway, we decided that in probably the next ten years, there will be some sort of uprising, if not full out rebellion.  Now that would kick ass.  All we'd need is a Thomas Paine and a John Paul Jones.  Oh, and a George Washington.  Maybe that's my calling, and if it is, that would kick ass.  I mean, if there's one thing I'd like to see changed in this world, it would be the restoration of all the ideals that so many brave men gave their lives defending.  Honor, integrity, liberty, fraternity, and freedom.

Still trying to think of ideas for a movie....it's a lot harder than it seems.

So now I have to start the job search all over again, as a broken collarbone prevents me from working anywhere I was before.  Four weeks? Not cool. I mean, come on- Tyler Hamilton raced the Tour de France last year (already one of the most if not the most grueling sports event ever held), and placed fourth, all with a broken collarbone!!  He broke it on the first day, and to quote him, "the doctors didn't know it was broken, so i just kept riding."  Amazing.  Now that takes guts.  Not only this, but he won the hardest mountain stage.  Good lord.  Again, to quote him, "that really, really hurt."  I wish I could ride that far.  Or that fast.  Either would be cool.  But, alas, I am no god.  

But for now, it's off to the books to study for a calculus test (to try and garner that A that I need so badly....)

Just got back from an amazing weekend at Rob's cottage, and as expected, there was much pain involved.  But, as we all know from experience, that's what those weekends are known for.  Friday was really good- got some waterskiing in, and some high quality four-person moto-boarding (take a windsurfing board, remove the sail, add four people, a Baja, and towing rope, and you have retardedly awesome entertainment).  So much fun.  And then Mary came!!! Which was just simply amazing.  That night was incredible, as was the rest of the weekend.  I love seeing that smile.....  But anyways, I left the lake with a busted shoulder that's feeling much better, and a hundred good memories.  Even though things were going downhill for awhile, it was still awesome fun.  Like always.  Only better.  Things seem to be going more or less the way that I want them to, which is a good thing. Not as good as they could be, but not nearly as bad as they could be, either.  And definitely more good than bad.  So, things are looking up for this summer.  Things with my parents could be going better (well, just with Mom.....), but all I want is to be able to talk to my mom without a lecture, which will never happen.  Even if I sit her down and tell her this, she'll go go into her "everyone hates me, i'm never right, i should just quit" routine.  Uggh.  I just wish that I could talk to her.  That would make things so much better and easier.  But, that's for sometime in the future.  I have a feeling if I do crack it, the conversation will take a long time.....which is good, though.   
But as long as I have memories of those starry nights and the thoughts they bring.....i'll be quite content.  In fact, when I have those thoughts, it seems that nothing could go wrong.....

It's starting to come back to me: passion, drive, goals.  It feels good.  And I'm making money at a job that I don't mind working, which is good.  I might finally have a job during the week! Helping my mom clean out 2000 some bags, which should be....um....work that pays.  Things are going really well so far this summer, and this weekend promises to be quite fun.  Now that school is out, perhaps we can have reeeal Halo parties....meaning instead of four people on two TV's, at least four people on each....now that would kick ass.

Wow, I'm beat.  Yesterday morning wasn't bad, prom was very good, and I had fun, but after all that and work this morning, my feet are pretty much shot.  But, it's alright.  They'll get better.  Hopefully I will be able to see Harry Potter sometime tonight, that would fantastic.  Don't work there again until Saturday, but I hope I can pick up hours sometime during the week, because at eight dollars an hour, I'll do all I can...  That's all for now

Yeah, so I did not think it was possible to break an SD1 General drumstick (but, apparently it is).  The things are huge, and they never break.  Oh well...good thing I had another floating around, so I could keep on playing.  

Halo party last night with Mike, Rob and Phil- so much fun.  Phil is so amazing at it it's incredible.  We'll definitely have to do it again sometime.

Well, here's the historic first entry in my LiveJournal.


Upon the wings of joy I spend my life,
And as I bask in sweet sunshine once more, 
I look around myself to find my friends,
And find them flying high among the clouds.
